isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The hydraulic brake actuation system includes a Hydro-Max™ booster assembly, master cylinder assembly, backup pump and monitor module. The monitor module is located inside the cab under the instrument panel ( Figure 1).
Additional conditions affecting the electrical operation of the brake monitoring system and backup pump can be found in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

The on-vehicle repair of the Hydro-Max™ booster or the master cylinder is limited to replacement of the backup pump (Item 2), flow switch (Item 3), relay (Item 4) and pressure differential switch (Item 7).

The master cylinder (Item 6) may be separated from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 1) for master cylinder replacement or to permit removing the Hydro-Max™ booster from the vehicle without removing the master cylinder or disconnecting the hydraulic brake fluid lines.

warning.para: When adding fluids, take care to identify fluids (power steering fluid or brake fluid) and use only in the proper system. Discard all fluid bled or drained from either system. Do not use for refill, cleaning or any other purpose. Failure to observe these precautions could result in failure of the brake system, with resultant personal injury and/or property damage.

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to Figure 1 for all items in parentheses.

If both the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 1) primary hydraulic system and the backup pump (Item 2) are not functioning, the brakes are still functional as non-power assisted hydraulic brakes. The brake pedal effort is transmitted directly through the booster from the brake pedal rod (Item 10) to the master cylinder pistons, manually applying the brakes. The brakes are operational but stopping distance is greatly increased due to the reduced force the operator is able to apply to the master cylinder.

The brake calipers and rotors and ABS control units are an integral part of the hydraulic brake system, but servicing them is covered separately. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the vehicle being serviced.
